thread.title: McDavid gets first multipoint game, Oilers beat Flames 5-2
thread.title_full: McDavid gets first multipoint game, Oilers beat Flames 5-2

title: McDavid gets first multipoint game, Oilers beat Flames 5-2
text:
Connor McDavid gets first multipoint game, Oilers beat Flames 5-2 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 10/18/15 1:19 am EDT - Updated: 10/18/15 1:19 am EDT 
CALGARY, Alberta â€” Connor McDavid scored twice and added an assist for the first multipoint game of his young career as the Edmonton Oilers beat the Calgary Flames 5-2 on Saturday night. 
McDavid broke a 1-1 tie with 3:29 left in the second period. After carrying the puck through the neutral zone, the 18-year-old used Kris Russell as a screen and scored past Jonas Hiller on a long wrist shot. 
With his parents in attendance, the first pick in last year's draft then capped the scoring with 3:40 left in the third, converting Taylor Hall 's pass for a power-play goal that brought out boos from the Flames (1-4-0) fans and loud cheers from the many Oilers fans in attendance. 
Hall also had a three-point game for Edmonton (1-4-0), with a goal and two assists. Ryan Nugent-Hopkins and Nail Yakupov also scored as the Oilers got goals from all four of their first-overall draft picks. 
Cam Talbot made 22 saves. Edmonton Oliers' Luke Gazdic, right, exchanges punches with Calgary Flames' Deryk Engelland during first-period NHL hockey game action in Calgary, Alberta, Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015. (Jeff McIntosh/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT
